column4: yes, i'm happy with the hostname, i only want to change what it says from the desktop
in 12.04 it appears that when you have no active windows, the top panel reads "ubuntu desktop"
i want to change it for the purposes of debranding
i have previously been using a different distro which came with debranding but it seems that since 11.10 they havnt bothered, which is a problem for me

yes i mean apart from the icons, i mean when you first log in, before you have loaded anything it just says "ubuntu desktop" that is obviously a problem if you cannot ship ubuntu vanilla for legal reasons
we have previously been using linux mint, but the changes in their desktop shell means inconsistancies with the interface - unity offers the best for that
i have tried debrandbuntu but it does not load the 12.04 iso
besides, this is surely something that is in a config file somewhere, it cant be in compiled code can it??
let me get this straight, you want to remove the branding and make a derivative?
so am i right in concluding you want to make a derivative of ubuntu?
so what is the point of debranding unless you want to create a derivative?
ah, so you are making a derivative then, since you are redistributing it with hardware
that is beyond the scope of this channel
mint doesn't use unity and isn't supported here either
then you'd need to ask for help in the mint channel
